website_summaries.verdict: Dual tension straps set the foot angle for individual needs. Breathable materials for comfort.
pros: Brace is on outside of foot, which many people prefer to a top-configured brace
Customers like the value they receive with this product
Some notice less pain within a few days
cons: Some wearers report being unable to sleep comfortably
Bulkier than some other plantar fasciitis splints

customer_reviews.title: Size 7.5 order a SMALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: New to wearing the brace, but kind of disappointed on the size I purchased. I wear a 7-7.5 usually and followed the chart in the pictures for this product and ordered the Medium. The instruction sheet that came along with my brace states that the Small fits up to a 7.5. With that being said, I definitely needed the Small as that my foot is devoured by the Medium. I wish the instructions would have been more clear and direct because I also had a lot of trouble putting it on.
customer_reviews.author: Stephany

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective and Sturdy Product
customer_reviews.text: The instructions lack info on how to use the enclosed wedge, but a physical therapist showed me how to set it up. He noted that many users err in trying to put the foot into a stretch and then give up because it’s uncomfortable. The splint is designed simply to hold the foot in a right angle to the leg, whic h greatly reduces morning pain for those suffering from plantar fasciitis. And this allows the inflammation to lessen and healing to occur. Once the belts are adjusted, it takes only seconds to put it on and take it off. I experienced no problems sleeping with it on.
customer_reviews.author: GLV

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide calves
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this I considered my foot size and never considered my calf. I have wide calf muscles and therefore my calf did not go all the way into the splint. Also, when I pulled the stap across the top of the foot, I almost ran out of velcro. I'm very disappointed because I need a splint that goes under my foot and will force my foot at the 90 degree angle, which the splint I currently have that goes on top of my foot does not.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Joan

customer_reviews.title: Fits Large Calves Well!
customer_reviews.text: I've been living in excessive pain for months with plantar fasciitis and tendonitis to the point I hobble when I walk and cry from frustration. I found these today and ordered them with one-day shipping. I was so nervous they wouldn't fit my large calves, but they did and very comfortably too!! I've bought cheaper night splints, I won't name names, but they didn't work at all. I've done everything I've been advised and tricks I've researched. I can't rate the pain relief until I see a significant difference then I'll come update this. **UPDATE** These really do hello relieve pain in the morning. Awkward and hard to sleep with at first, but once you work-it-out they're wonderful! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Way too cumbersome for sleep
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a night splint, but it is more like a walking cast/boot, and there is no way I was going to be able to sleep with it on, as it is so large and uncomfortable. I could barely stand having it on while sitting on the couch. I believe that there are other splints out there that are far more feasible for night time wear, as this design is positively archaic. I am now in the midst of trying to get this returned, and even though it is Prime eligible and fulfilled by Amazon, I am having to return it to the company, and will have to pay the shipping fees myself. An unfortunate purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bkrae

customer_reviews.title: Instant Relief
customer_reviews.text: Instant relief. I literally put this on as soon as it arrived and within 30mins, I was walking from the couch, not limping. This boot is VERY secure, but it takes some adjusting so your toes don't fall asleep. Taking the velcro wedge out from behind the toe are made it more comfortable for me. I've been suffering from plantar fasciitis for 8 months and have tried compression socks and other boots but nothing has provided relief like this boot. I ordered a small, which matches my shoe size of 7.5 and medium to large calves. Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Julie W.

customer_reviews.title: If You Have Plantar Fasciitis...You Need This!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to help cure my plantar fasciitis! Prompt delivery and excellent product! Used it for the first time last night and my foot felt much better this morning...especially with the first foot-plant getting out of bed. Lots of adjustments available w/ the 3 straps as well as the longer Velcro tighteners. The extra "wedge" for increased dorsi-flexion was another plus for this product. Very highly recommended for anyone out there dealing with plantar fasciitis. I also use ice regularly as well as stretching from my PT person. I'm an avid long distance walker and can't wait to get back out there once the plantar faciistis is sufficiently resolved...
customer_reviews.author: J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very uncomfortable. My heel kept slipping up when I lay down, so I had to make it really tight, and use the wedge under my toes. When I brought it to my foot doctor, he said it was way too tight, and did not recommend using the toe wedge at all. His office gave me a ‘ProWedge’ night splint (which Amazon carries), and the ProWedge is so much more comfortable- keeps my foot in the right position, and is soft. I actually keep it on all night.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Worsened my condition
customer_reviews.text: I’m so upset about this. They advertise this for being helpful for those that have plantars fasciitis and it turns out that stretching your plantars is not beneficial and can create even more micro tears which I’m fact is what happened. I’m so upset I cannot return these boots and I find out that they have worsened my condition. They should not be used for any sort of therapy. Be careful if you really suffer from this condition. This is not going to help the fact that you have micro tears on your plantars fascia since the position these boots put you in are indeed creating more tears or inflaming the existing ones.
customer_reviews.author: Iris Showalter

customer_reviews.title: At first I thought it would get the job done based on the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for almost two months and the straps/velcro are in the wrong place to give support and constantly slip, which was surprising, and the neoprene like support attached to the hard plastic backing around the calf is coming apart and metal connector tears at my calf. It is considered past the date for me to return it for poor construction. I would have expected something that looked this sturdy to last longer. I only wear it at night when I'm already in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My biggest problem is that if I tighten it to the point where it keeps my foot from relaxing then it's too tight and when I loosen it to where it is comfortable to wear all night I don't feel it is ...
customer_reviews.text: It definitely takes some getting used to. I was diagnosed with plantar fasciitis and was told by my foot doctor to get a night splint. My biggest problem is that if I tighten it to the point where it keeps my foot from relaxing then it's too tight and when I loosen it to where it is comfortable to wear all night I don't feel it is keeping my foot in the position it needs to be in. I ordered a different type of splint and I will compare the two and may come back and edit my review.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't secure foot well enough. Limited size adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: No matter how tight you make it, your foot will still bend and point... It won't keep it at a 90 degree bend or less. The velcro straps don't have enough velcro, so when you pull them tight, there's no place to stick it. It causes some stretching pain, but it only lasts until your foot pulls out of place. This thing wasn't meant to be comfortable, so idk why it was a rating option.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Works if you can handle sleeping in them
customer_reviews.text: This splint does work. It does relieve PF. I did try using this while I sleep and I just don't feel comfortable in them. I have had multiple anxiety attacks and/or waking up in the middle of the night, so uncomfortable that I have to take it off, from wearing this thing and I don't know why. But, if you are just sitting around, doing work on a computer or watching TV, this works. DO NOT WALK AROUND IN THESE; IT WILL MESS UP YOUR BACK! But overall, when using it correctly, it keeps your foot stretched, while the tissues on the feet heal. I highly recommend it if you have PF.
customer_reviews.author: Saved

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable thing in the world
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable thing in the world. However, I went front being unable to walk each morning to moving well. I find I don't sleep as well wearing this but I function better throughout the day. I ordered the largest and my toes (size 11.5) overhang the boot. Again in the long run I find myself mostly pain free at the end of the day. Could be better as far as fit and feel but the discomfort as out paced by the healing. If you are a light or sensitive sleeper you may have trouble but I have yet to something better.
customer_reviews.author: Morsey Gatustrid

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: This thing is 10 times better than the dumb crap my doctor sent me home with. That one made my foot fall asleep and was extremely uncomfortable. I could only wear it half the night without waking up and ripping it off so i could sleep. This one is excellent. Holds your foot at the right angle without cutting off circulation. I love it, and felt so much better when I woke up.
customer_reviews.author: imar0ckstar

customer_reviews.title: Works...that's it
customer_reviews.text: One night and 95% less pain. Hoping over time 100% will subside. Not sure what else I should share. I read the same from another review but didn't believe it, seemed made up. Amazon's incredibly return policy allowed me to try it out. WORKS! PROS: Works, 95-99% pain gone. CONS: woke me up twice, comfortable to sleep with but not entirely. Seems like I can get used to it though.
customer_reviews.author: Neomass

customer_reviews.title: WELL MADE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this boot on the advice of a friend with plantar fasciitis, who's podiatrist had recommended it to him. I wear a size 8.5/9 women's shoe, so ordered the medium based on size chart, but it was three inches too long! Returned medium and purchased the small, which is the correct size for my shoe size. Good sturdy boot!
customer_reviews.author: Edith Grace

customer_reviews.title: Worth wearing in order to get relief from PF
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help relieve my plantar fasciitis pain. It really works, I replaced the other splint that I used because the Velcro had worn out. You have to get used to wearing this but once you do you’ll feel the results.
customer_reviews.author: Whatever It’s my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Dramatic improvement for my plantar fasciitis . Try it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased small. I wear 8-8.5 shoe but have very high arches and bony feet. Small fits fine. Any larger and I don’t think I could get a snug fit. Very uncomfortable stretch and some numbness my first night, so I needed to take it on and off several times, but this morning my foot feels dramatically better! No kidding. Usually feels like stepping on a nail in the morning. For the price, this is very sturdy and well made. Very very happy I tried it. All my stretching, massaging, orthotics and ice helped but this will really push my recovery! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Don’t over pay crazy office/insurance prices.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was needed without even knowing. Saved a ton of money out of pocket. Would have cost triple at the doctors office. Attempt to sleep with and use per doctors advice but still ended up with tendon surgery. Because I had it, it’s continied to be used during rehab and at night during the long healing process. Protects at night without having to wear a large boot and gives the added protection while resting on the couch too. If only more doctors would be honest enough to suggest this purchase over what the insurance will cover. It’s the exact same thing prescribed in the ortho office by the doctor! Not cheap quality. Used as directed by doctor.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S

customer_reviews.title: Works -- Yet for me, there's a better way...
customer_reviews.text: Tried this several months back. My plantar fasciitis definitely got better. However, for me at least there's a better way: Stretch your Achilles tendon (calf) daily, and several times a day, when sitting down, like watching t.v. or on computer, etc. massage your calf from heel to upper calf (I typically gently squeeze with thumb & fingers along entire length of calf for perhaps half a minute or longer... If it works for you, you should notice improvement in a mere day or so. Guess it improves circulation to injured area... Maybe such as vitamin c, etc also aid this improvement? Good luck & God Bless!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: The video provided was very helpful to get the adjustments just right. I am only using it when watching TV vs. sleeping with it, and found my tolerance in wearing it is about an hour long before my foot starts falling asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Laniz

customer_reviews.title: Torturous to sleep in - Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended I wear this at night. I have a boot during the day. I lasted about 10 minutes trying to sleep in this thing. Maybe if you are a back sleeper this would work, but if you are a side sleeper light me, this will be torturous, since the exterior has many points that hurt the non-booted leg when in contact. I also didn't like the fit, which didn't feel at all contoured to my leg the way the boot is. It created a number of uncomfortable pressure points and caused swelling that wasn't there before. I didn't have it too tight, but it still did this. Horrible. Will not use.
customer_reviews.author: C. P. Tello Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: This thing actually helps
customer_reviews.text: I’m not going to try to describe how much pain I experience with my feet but know it’s nearly unbearable...this splint, however, really gives me some relief when I use it. Wish I was more consistent but it works. It doesn’t have the best support in keep my foot in place while on but I still get some relief the next day.
customer_reviews.author: lyfe85

customer_reviews.title: The clasps are on the right side ( boots are universal for either foot) so the “left” boot is easy to get on
customer_reviews.text: Do they work? I don’t know, I could never keep them on for longer than an hour or two when watching a movie... and never at night for bed. They are too clunky and it’s impossible to get to sleep! The clasps are on the right side ( boots are universal for either foot) so the “left” boot is easy to get on, the “right” boot impossible as the clasps are on the outside and I don’t bend that way easily. I felt extremely claustrophobic in these and I would never recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally getting relief!
customer_reviews.text: Liked: Lightweight and not bulky, great price, true to size. Of course anything constricting movement can seem uncomfortable but after the 3rd consecutive night, I got used to it. I’ve been suffering with plantar fasciitis for almost a year and I’ve tried numerous remedies that never made my foot feel better. After 4 days of wearing this to bed, I can finally at least step on the floor without pain. I will continue to wear it until I don’t experience any pain throughout the day. I wear a 61/2-7 size shoe and the small boot fits perfect with just about an inch extending beyond my big toe.
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to a huge boot
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist put me in a huge knee high boot for tendinitis of the foot. It was pretty impossible to walk in and was causing hip and back pain almost immediately. I purchased this splint to wear around the house and it did a great job for pain relief in no time! I tried wearing it to sleep but it just isn’t something that’s easy to get used to. So I’ve been using it while awake and it’s been super helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Kells79

customer_reviews.title: It Works but hard to wear at night
customer_reviews.text: I have Plantar Fascitis and it has not gone away for several months now so I tried these splits at the recommendation of my foot doctor. They are easy to put on for me but the strap over the top of my foot is too tight and causes a burning on my foot so I have to leave that strap open. The biggest problem is sleeping with both feet in the split. I endure most nights because it seems to be helping.
customer_reviews.author: MBS

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: If you have pain in your foot and it won't go away this will help. I couldn't believe the difference it made in just a couple of days. The instructions were not very helpful but if your heel doesn't sit all the way down it's ok. cross the straps on your foot this helps a lot. I didn't wear it for more than an hour at a time. I ordered the small and it was plenty big for me. I wear an 8. If you have very thick calves you might want to do a medium. Overall it was worth the inconvenience and slight discomfort to get rid of the pain
customer_reviews.author: Kyrak

customer_reviews.title: This was podiatrist recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was told that I had inflammation in my heel along with plantar fasciitis. This was "prescribed," for three weeks, to wear at night as a way to keep the foot extended, while I slept, so it was not painful to put weight on it in the morning. I don't have pain in the morning anymore. It isn't too cumbersome and it only took a night or so to adjust to sleeping with it. It's lightweight and uses Velcro and plastic "snaps" to secure in three different places from the foot to the shin. The size fit as it states. The instruction booklet states it is NOT for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant because of the size of this splint but after wearing it continuously night after night. I have seen and felt the benefits of wearing it. This splint has helped the healing process of my foot UPDATE: I've used this boot continuously and my foot pain has gone away. With regular stretching during the day this boot has helped alot. Ad for most people complaining about the straps, I have chicken legs and I have left the boot with enough play for movement (also I found out the hard way if you tighten the straps all the way it cuts off circulation). All in all, it works
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I wear men's size 11 and ordered a large. ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear men's size 11 and ordered a large. It is plenty large, photo attached for reference. But this thing works. I have planterfacitus and no foot pain when i jump out of bed in the morning I was walking on razor blades before and now nothing in the morning. i wish they had a left and right shoe so that the catches were always on the inside. The pain sneaks back during the day if i dont keep it active. Now if i could figure what to do during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Redmutt

customer_reviews.title: Helping my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: The podiatrist rec this type of night splint (boot) vs the neoprene type that wrap. I’ve been wearing it at night to sleep & do notice a diff. Ordered women Med & wear a 8.5-9 ref width. Still plenty of room for larger shoe size & width. It’s summer in SF & not too warm to wear at night but our temps don’t get too high. Based off cost & results I’d recommend trying this therapy as it’ll give your foot the support you’ll need during sleep - when sometimes your foot tends to bend or flex too much or in weird positions.
customer_reviews.author: sfmom

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with this product and it is helping my pain ...
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this product and it is helping my pain from Plantar Fasciitis. Splints in general are no fun, but this one is fairly comfortable and most importantly it keeps the foot in the proper position. For best results, start by wearing it for a few hours at night and build up your time. If you can only wear it part of the night, my podiatrist said to put it on in the middle of the night so you can get at least 3-4 hours wearing time before actually getting out of bed and putting your feet on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: GumbyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great item but get the correct size
customer_reviews.text: Get the correct size-measure your foot length: This has great therapeutic effect but size large from the chart was too big for my 12.5 shoe size. I then looked at the foot bed measurement, measured my foot and ordered the medium... just right. It works great. I tried the elastic strap type and it did NOT work for me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wright

customer_reviews.title: This is what WORKED for Me!
customer_reviews.text: This really worked for me when nothing else did. I wore it for about 2 months and my plantar fasciitis gradually disappeared. I tried literally everything, including PT, podiatrist, stretches, foam rollers, ice rollers, expensive running shoes—and this is what worked for me. Was it comfortable to wear to sleep in? Nope! But the relief it brought was so worth it. Took some experimenting to get the fit where it was most effective. But for me this was a great purchase. My PF has not returned since I used it over a year ago. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: katmoonblue

customer_reviews.title: Mediums still too big for the listed max foot size (9.5)
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9.5 mens. According to their chart, I got a size medium. I tightened all of the straps as far as they'll go and my foot still just slips right out of the boot. Not sure I even want to bother with the hassle of returning them and getting the small size ones to see if they work. I paid all of this money to have my feet end up just as straight when I lay down without the boots on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As a nurse, I wasn't sure if this would ...
customer_reviews.text: As a nurse, I wasn't sure if this would really work. Most of the contraptions I've purchased over the years have been slightly helpful but these are actually very helpful! I wear them nightly when the issue flares up and after 3 months of intermittent use, I have not had any foot pain in 3 months. So 6 months after purchase, I found that these have kept me pain free for the longest of any treatments thus far!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: So helpful and really works for runner’s plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This boot works! Is it comfortable to sleep in? Not really, but if you’re suffering from plantar fasciitis badly enough (like I was) it’s worth it. I recommend a few things though: 1. Use the boot to ice your fascia for 20 min each night before you go to sleep-just a simple blue/gel ice pack-with a thin sock on it. 2. Don’t use it for walking. They say not to as well, but I did it once and it scuffed up our hardwood floors with a weird residue. I would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Becca Puffer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I think this would work great if I wore it more often. I can only keep it on for a few hours while I’m sleeping. My toes go numb so I end up taking it off. However, I can wear it longer while I’m watching tv or doing office work. I purchased small because I have small feet, but the strap that goes around ankle could be a little looser for me, like about 1/4 of an inch. You can’t beat the price. They are so expensive in the stores or doctor offices for the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Relief
customer_reviews.text: It felt like I was stepping on knives in the heel of my foot. After two nights sleeping with this splint I was better. After the 3rd night I could get up and walk with no pain. I didn't know what the small wedge was for and found out it was to put under my toes to stretch the foot more - last night I slept with it off and on and my foot and leg had a great stretch all night. I had a different brace but my specialist said it was not the right one and he was correct!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: ... wear at night that would be low profile and easy to sleep in
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and I was looking for something to wear at night that would be low profile and easy to sleep in. This wasn't it. I felt like it was a smaller version of my walking boot. Quality was good. I ordered the correct size but the boot stuck out over 2 inches past my toes. Very uncomfortable. I have tried the plantar sock but it felt like my toes were being stretched and I couldn't last the entire night with it on.
customer_reviews.author: Volprincess24

customer_reviews.title: So large it could have fit Bigfoot!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the recommended size in the chart. I wear a women's 9.5 (sometimes a 10) and bought the MEDIUM. It is so huge that I cannot use it. Even when it's tightened all the way, I can pull my foot out of it. I did much better with the compression sock brace. I'm going to try to return. If they won't take it back, it's going to the local medical lending locker. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Magical Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Works very well at relieving morning foot pain!!
customer_reviews.text: Works even better than I expected at relieving my pain in the morning! It took a couple days getting used to it, but it’s really no problem now. I even wear two. One on each foot. Sleeping with a pillow between my knees when on my side does help (when I didn’t do that, I’d have a sore back in the morning). Also when sleeping in my stomach, it helps to scoot down so my foot/feet can hang off the bottom of the bed. The boots are very easily adjustable too! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Noel

customer_reviews.title: Watch the sizing
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and hope this will help. It arrived quickly and in perfect shape. I’m a women’s 7.5 so I bought a medium. It is pretty big on me and I probably really needed a small. The instructions that come with it has slightly different sizing than the Amazon description. Having said that, I’m too lazy to return it so we will see how things go. I have only had it a few days and find I have to remove it after a few hours in bed. I’m hoping that changes. This looks just like the one the doctor prescribes and costs a lot less. It’s worth a try for those with this condition.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey B.

customer_reviews.title: This boot healed me!! - tried a different brace design and that other design didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I tried a different kind of night brace (the soft kind with the brace on the dorsal side of the foot- looked like a more comfy design for at night, lightweight, with straps that went around the foot), but I couldn't wear it past 1AM. So I bought this big old boot design, and although it is kind of cumbersome, IT HEALED MY PLANTAR'S! I've had pain for over 9 months, and in less than a month ( think it took a couple weeks) of wearing this boot, I was healed. Sometimes I would take it off in the middle of the night, but more often than not I wore it through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Works but Not Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This brace is big and bulky. Hard to sleep with it BUT it works. If you can sleep with these kind of braces to keep your foot at a 90 degree angle for a month, it helps tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie S. Lively

customer_reviews.title: Quality is Good, but runs large
customer_reviews.text: I am a women's size 7, and my foot is on the narrow side. The small was the recommended size, but still feels way too big. I can not get the adjustments tight enough to keep my foot from moving around, and as such I m not getting the full benefit from the splint. My foot will not stay at a 90 degree angle. The product itself is good quality, that is why I gave it 4 stars; just wish it was smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Wallys Mom

customer_reviews.title: Work well for plantar fasciitis issues
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy 2 because I have pain in both feet but they work very well to deal with my plantar fasciitis problem. If I don't wear them for a couple nights I'm definitely regretting it on my morning hike or run. They're bulky but well-made and it takes some getting used to sleeping with them on. However, it only took me a few nights and now I don't even notice them while I'm sleeping. Not the greatest for walking in to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, you just have to be careful (and when walking around in the dark, try to not kick the dog in the face with them!).
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Helps
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly as pictured. I was told to sleep in this and I’ve tried but I can’t haha it’s not the products fault, i just like to stretch my feet out when I’m sleeping and am very particular. But I found laying on my back with my foot propped up is the most comfortable. So anytime I sit down to watch tv or ice my foot I wear it and it has helped a lot. I also wear it when I go to bed and watch tv or browse my phone for an hour or two then take it off to actually fall asleep. The straps are adjustable so no matter your leg size that shouldn’t be an issue
customer_reviews.author: Momto4

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This works amazing, I was having issues with the plantar fasciitis. I could hardly walk and the doctor told me to get a brace. I didn't want to pay 50.00 for one and found this. I wore this brace for 4 hours the first night and again the second night. After the third night of wearing for around four hours, I woke up with no pain and able to walk so much better. I wore the brace 1 hour a week for several months, and then eventually didn't need it. I keep it if I should need it but I don't experience pain in my feet anymore. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Logsdon

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design caused more pain than I previously had
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a nightmare! Ridiculous design. The buckles are set against the boot with push tabs that make it almost impossible to release. Woke up in the night with foot throbbing in pain. Couldn't get the buckles to release. Had to turn lights on and hobble to a chair. Finally got it off and went back to bed in pain!
customer_reviews.author: EJM

customer_reviews.title: if u in a lot of pain making that first step in the morning I highly recommend to try this
customer_reviews.text: It works magically. Makes a big difference getting up in the morning. It's taking long time to heal plantar fasciitis which is normally expected and this splint definitely making a difference for me. You have to adjust the strap to feel more comfortable depending on a day if ur leg is more/less swollen but if u in a lot of pain especially making that first step in the morning I highly recommend to try this. This price is definitely less than my co-pays to the doctor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that worked for my Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I had to put a pause on my half marathon training and long-distance hikes after I developed plantar fasciitis on my left feet. I tried several inserts, insoles, and shoes. Finally, this is what worked. FIgured out that the calf, hamstrings, and glutes had become tight because of my frequent workouts without proper stretching. This caused the plantar muscles to get pulled resulting in plantar fasciitis. Yoga stretches and wearing this boot for 10-15 minutes a day even while watching the TV has helped to relieve the pain and hopefully keep it off.
customer_reviews.author: Milind V. Mahale

customer_reviews.title: I Would Purchase it Again (if I needed to)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to help plantar fasciitis that won't go away. Excellent customer service! Decently priced, great quality. The company reaches out to you to provide helpful tips and the return process was easy and stress-free. I give it 5 stars because of all of the wonderful customer service and quality. For me personally, it did not help the way I needed it to and was uncomfortable and painful to sleep in. Despite it not working for me, it was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: You do not need the wedge that comes with it because the long vertical strap does that. You can winch your foot till it cant flex anymore for a great overnight stretch. I have worn this several nights and you get used to it and the discomfort subsides. The buckles work, the Velcro makes adjustment easy, the plastic "boot" is rounded and comfy. The boot does have a soft rubbery pad glued to the base so you don't slip if you need to hop out of bed for a midnight squirt. For the price these cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Lost in PA

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard for this 77-year-old male to get on and off by himself. I am not, by the way, in bad shape at all. Because of bone spurs, it was impossible for me to wear these without excruciating pain. I had to immediately remove them and return them. I’m not suggesting that everyone will have pain when they use these. It just did not work for me. For me because of my age and the fact I have hardwood floors, I Feared for a possible fall during the process of putting these on.
customer_reviews.author: DaytonaKen

customer_reviews.title: A must if you want to get rid of your heal spur pain
customer_reviews.text: 2 nights wearing this boot to bed has almost totally cleared my heal spur symptoms. I had surgery on this several years ago & they sliced the bottom of my foot & then I had to wear a cast for about a month. Not sure why it started hurting again, maybe being on a ladder. Anyway this boot has stopped the pain that recently came back!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Runs very large!
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this product on the advice of his podiatrist, same product here as available through insurance, but a fraction of the price. Good product, but sizing is way off. I wear a size 8.5/9 shoe (women's), and the medium was three inches too long! Have returned for the small. It is the correct size for me. Just a word of caution for others ordering and wondering about the size. It is a very secure boot!
customer_reviews.author: Edith Grace

customer_reviews.title: Pain relief
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had plantar fasciitis for years and it got worse when I got pregnant. This brace is a life saver! After just 2 days of night wear the 3rd morning I had no pain. Of course it doesn’t keep the pain away due to having a child I move a lot so some pain does return but after the night of sleeping with it, the pain is gone again. It’s amazing to have such pain relief and enjoy play time with my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I wear a womens shoe size 8 and this fits very comfortably with lots of room. There is a adjustable wedge piece that goes under the toes to flex foot. It is great this piece is adjustable so I can increase or decrease the stretch on my arch. Great product, comfortable for what it is. My doctor pulled this up online during my appointment and said to buy it. This is in addition to a steroid shot, shoe inserts and stretches. I already have less pain. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Murren

customer_reviews.title: This is the 3rd option I tried and it's finally ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd option I tried and it's finally the right one! I can't believe how much relief it's giving me. I wake up pain free! Is it awkward to sleep with? Yes but I've adjusted to it by sleeping flat on my back. And for me, it's worth it to be pain free. The other 2 splints I tried were smaller but they pulled at the top of my foot instead of the bottom and they helped a little but didn't work. So I'd rather have something bulky that works than something less bulky that doesn't work!
customer_reviews.author: TKW

customer_reviews.title: Seems to Help
customer_reviews.text: My podiatrist scoffed when I mentioned the night splint, however a couple friends had this recommended by their podiatrist. When my PF flairs up I can usually get relief from using it. It does, however, take a while to get used to. There is nothing pleasant about wearing this, but that has nothing to do with the design. It is just an awkward treatment we need to endure to help fix the problem. Easy to get on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Gochnauer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing this splint for several days now. I was very skeptical!! I have suffered with heel spurs for longer than I can remember. Usually when I wake up in the morning I cannot even set my foot down on the floor. I have to hobble on one foot while trying to put pressure on the injured foot. This splint has allowed me to walk when I get up, not without pain but I can walk. The splint stretches the foot and lower leg in the manner it needs to alleviate pain from the heel spur. I would suggest this item for anyone suffering from this issue!
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Flintstone Feet
customer_reviews.text: It looks like it would work well. I purchased this for my BF. He's only used it a couple of times. He complained that it was a little bit small. I looked at the splint and saw that it was labeled as a "Medium". There was a little circular sticker on the side of it. I had ordered a Large. We'll keep it and hopefully, he'll use it more often. Just wished that it was a little bigger for Mr. Fred Flintstone Feet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Armbrust

customer_reviews.title: It helps
customer_reviews.text: I have pain in my heel from bone spurs. The pain was worst right after waking up and trying to walk. After a few days of wearing the splint for just 30 mins to an hour a day has significantly reduced that morning pain. I've tried wearing the splint at night, but the pain from having the splint on for so long was too much. So far it hasn't done much for the pain from running or going down stairs but I'm hopeful it will get better with continued use.
customer_reviews.author: gpburdell

customer_reviews.title: Not Enough Cushion
customer_reviews.text: This boot will work but it is very uncomfortable. There is virtually no cushion. The wedge to boost the angle of the forefoot is very hard. It's like pressing your foot into a brick all night. Plantar Fascitis feels better but makes my forefoot hurt - alot! I think it could be better if it had a little padding. Would not recommend. Solves one problem but causes another!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Stader

customer_reviews.title: Woke Without Heel Pain for the First Time in Months
customer_reviews.text: I've had constant pain from my Plantar Fasciitis for 7 MONTHS. The first night I tried this, I woke up without ANY heel pain at all. I continue to use this nightly and am still waking up without heel pain. Since the plantar fasciitis tendon needs to be stretched to be fixed, I am able to adjust the angle little by little to stretch, and increase the range of motion. I would caution you against increasing the angle too quickly. I would highly recommend this to you if you are having pain from you plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Burkart

customer_reviews.title: Posterior Night Splint - Plantar Fasciitis Relief
customer_reviews.text: I initially didn't realize that I had Plantar Fasciitis until I talked with a couple of co-workers. One volunteered to loan me his splint and I only tried it because he went to all the trouble to bring it to work. After the first, night I noticed a difference in my pain level but still wasn't convinced. After three nights, I had relief for the first time in months. I am back to hiking again. I decided to buy my own splint so I would have it in the event of a flare up. I love having drug free relief.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Schumaker

customer_reviews.title: I had to wake up and take them off
customer_reviews.text: I have achilles tendon pain in the morning (first 10 steps). Went to the doctor and I was recommended Night splint. I have been experimenting with different products and this one is not good for me. Why did I return them: 1- Too bulky, its like i'm going for a roller blade ride not going to bed lol 2- The heel does not sit in place tucked in corner like its showing in pictures which lead to the 3rd issue below 3- Because the heel is not in place, all the pressure is centered in the capsulitis area of the foot which lead to pain within hours of wearing. I had to wake up and take them off
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Very well made product and the quality was great. I only used for two nights before I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product and the quality was great. I only used for two nights before I finally saw a podiatrist. They would not have worked for me since I have stage 2 plantar fasciitis where the plantar fascia has a bunch of tiny microtears in the ligament. He said these help for stage 1 plantar fasciitis though, so if that is what you have then they might work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Mahan

customer_reviews.title: It does give relief
customer_reviews.text: This definetly does help with planter faciatis. But .. This particular foot brace is a little bulky. I got used to sleeping with it. But bought a size that was a little too big. So my foot would feel like it would slide out and if I tighten the straps then my foot would go numb from losing circulation. So definitely don't buy a a size too big. So in general it definitely does give relief and I would wake up being able to actually walk on my foot. It's just a little bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Charly/Chrystal

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I was a bit worried about the fit but it worked out wonderfully. Ordered a Medium for my size 9W woman's foot. I started with 30 minutes and am now at 1hr I swear it actually works! I've been getting painful cortisone shots for my plantar fasciitis and the instant relief from this was insane. I haven't walked barefoot on my wood floor in months and I was able to do so right after wearing this. It does take some getting used too my toes went a bit numb the first couple of times but it goes away. Wish I had found this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn S.

customer_reviews.title: I loosened the angle/tightness for the second night and it worked great. I will gradually increase the flex/tightness over time
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this at night during sleep about a week ago. The first night I had it cranked too tight (painful). I loosened the angle/tightness for the second night and it worked great. I will gradually increase the flex/tightness over time. The gentle ovenight flex keeps your tendons stretched. Now I have no pain when I get out of bed in the morning. Plan to buy a second one for the other foot. Well made, easy to put on at night & take off in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Relief!
customer_reviews.text: These splints will give you some relief from plantar fasciitis. I hope the effects last longer and longer. I have used them for a few weeks and I only wear one at night now as my right foot is not hurting at all. My left still hurts if I sit still or sleep for more than an hour without the splint. So I will continue to wear the splint on that foot. I had the shot in my left foot and wear Dr prescribed insoles. I tried drugs and stretches and I still have pain. The splint is the first thing that I think may fix it or make it tolerable for the long term.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Try this product BEFORE anything else.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been struggling with a heel spur plantar fasciitis for 7 months. I’ve tried pt, shoe inserts, steroid injection and no relief. This was the second type of night splint I ordered and it’s crazy but I took my first ten steps this morning pain free. It took a few nights for me to get used to but after wearing it all night the difference is UNBELIEVABLE. I was about ready to insist on surgery to remove the spur since I felt like I had tried it all. I don’t normally do reviews but if I can save someone else time and money on everything I’ve tried to relieve my heal pain I wanted to do it. Try this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to help relieve the pain.  Well made. Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Well made. Definitely puts your foot at the right angle for plantar fasciitis foot pain . Helped recover from that pain symptom. Bought a larger size for my husband to use as well. Using for 9.5-10 women's and 13 mens shoe sizes. Fits good for both although probably a tad big for me but staps are easily adjustable (my toes have plenty of room). Not really a walking boot. Best used at night. Pain is gone now but I still use boot on occasion to keep foot in check. That pain is no joke !
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best splint I’ve found!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the splints I’ve tried, this one is the best. I wear a 7 1/2 -8 in women’s and the medium was too big for me. The small works perfectly. The straps are padded & comfortable & the clips make it easy to remove. The side Velcro adjustments are a nice addition and allow for relief if pulled too tight. My advice, wear it for a while when watching tv or just relaxing to work up to wearing it all night.
customer_reviews.author: EmDub

customer_reviews.title: Great Pain Relief
customer_reviews.text: I've been dealing with international Achilles tendinitis for four months. After seeing my orthapedic doc he recommended a night splint as a potential solution. I have not tired several and found that this one works best. Quick to put on, more comfortable than others, feels durable, and most importantly is has definitely reduced the pain I feel. After using for three days the pain was almost gone completely. One minor note, wear a size 9 shoe, and found that I have to tighten the velcro straps to the max for this to fit. I likely would go down one size if I were to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: NRB

customer_reviews.title: I also really liked being able to adjust the straps
customer_reviews.text: This night splint does work. However it is uncomfortable and heavy. Because it's bulky you are forced to sleep on your back and the weight of boot would make my lower leg turn out causing my knee to become very sore. It does the job of stretching the bottom of your foot and the wedge was helpful for me. I also really liked being able to adjust the straps. For the price it's worth it but I rarely use it anymore it definitely works better then a dorsal splint but much more cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the arse to put on!!!!! If you can...
customer_reviews.text: Well, from the pictures it looks pretty simple to put on. WRONG!!! It would be if the buckles/clasps were on the inside if you are placing on your right foot.... but installing on your right foot requires dexterity beyond my 36” sleeve length reach! The proper design would be buckles/clasps on the inside of the boot. Would work for either foot that way. But it seems the chinese don’t know anything about human factors or man-machine interface or none of them ever tried one on or they wear longer than 36” shirt sleeves! Very poorly designed and if you need it on your right foot you have to have help!!!
customer_reviews.author: Obi Ron Kenobi

customer_reviews.title: This Night Splint really works!
customer_reviews.text: I had a terrible pain in my left foot, I was told by my doctor it was Planter Fasciitis. I tried different things that did nothing to help the pain. My docter suggested a night splint, so I tried this one and it worked, it took a while but it really worked. My wife is now having the same problem so I purchased one for her. I highly recommend this, it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner

customer_reviews.title: Needs instructions for usage.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's operator error or the size was off. I had to order two because my foot kept slipping out once I would lay down in bed. The small seemed to work better but my foot still slips out. Came with zero instructions so it's hard to pin point the problem other than tweek it constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Runs large, good design
customer_reviews.text: I bought a medium as I wear a women's size 8-9 shoe and it's too big. I have the straps pulled as far as they will go and they are still too loose on my leg. However, I like that the boot goes past my toes so the weight of the blankets doesn't hurt my toes. It's reasonably comfortable and easy to put on. It has helped with the foot pain.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B

customer_reviews.title: get this one - the others are just toys...
customer_reviews.text: Very adjustable and provides real and precise support. The heel is very slick if walking in it so use caution especially on a hard surface.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a sock on that foot inside the splint. Perhaps that is why it seems a bit difficult to keep my foot tight inside it. In spite of that, I like it and very happy with the purchase. The surfaces are all well finished and are no problem in moving with the sheets to avoid catching or snagging. I would certainly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: onoguy

customer_reviews.title: Yeah pain went away
customer_reviews.text: Done my exercise with rolling my foot over an ice bottle for about 5 to 10 minutes and another 3 minutes I used a golf ball and then I used the boot and slept in it about 3hrs took it off ,do to getting uncomfortable. Before getting ready for the day or when ever I had some time (working from home) and could put my foot up, I was wearing the boot. I truly recommend this boot.
customer_reviews.author: Petra

customer_reviews.title: First day. I wear a woman's 11 shoe so ...
customer_reviews.text: First day. I wear a woman's 11 shoe so I bought the large splint. As you see you on pick its huge. Guessing medium would have worked. Its bulky but I definitely feel the stretch of my hell flap. Thats not a typo. Heel flap would be too kind. Ive been living in hell for a year with heel and Achilles pain. By evening I'm hobbled and by morning the pain is excruciating. Right now tires are numb and it took a few tries to get straps right. I took wedge out to relieve numbness. Fingers crossed that this works.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: I have PF. Bought this  very sexy boot for bed.  time
customer_reviews.text: I think I’m going to go with this one. Looks like it’s a little big it’s a medium. I’m ordering the small . I am going to try it and keep the best fit . I’ve had it on while I watch TV today. When I get up I take it off. Those of you with with plantars fasciitis knows when you first get up it hurts like hell. But not when you use the boot . My second picture it shows a wedge for Under the toes . As you advance and get used to it you can apply that for more left under the toes to stretch the tendons and your foot .
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: When my plantar fasciitis got so bad I could hardly walk
customer_reviews.text: When my plantar fasciitis got so bad I could hardly walk, this splint was a big part of my recovery. I only had one foot that I had to wear it on at night, so it was not too bad when sleeping. The trade off of sleeping with this splint was well worth getting up in the morning and walking without excruciating pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This boot worked miracles for my tendinitis in my heel! I was in so much pain and nothing was helping so luckily I found this boot and gave it a shot! I wore it for several weeks consistently while sleeping and slowly my heel got better and better until the pain was completely gone! I was desperate for any relief and was surprised this not only provided relief but actually healed my tendinitis! Highly recommend trying this!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well
customer_reviews.text: I injured my Achilles’ tendon and plantar fasciitis tendon and was in extreme pain. I ordered this to sleep with at night and by the next morning the pain was so much better. I wear it every night as it takes quite awhile for these injuries to heal but it has made a huge difference. I would definitely recommend if you have any door pain.
customer_reviews.author: Christine S.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased
customer_reviews.text: Works great, especially for the price! I’ve used other boots/stabilizers, and MUCH prefer this one over all the others because it’s so easy to put on and take off—the velcro straps actually stay in place on this product!!! :) My only complaint is that it’s pretty loose around my calf, even when tightened down completely... I just wrap a long sock or light towel around my leg and cinch it down until it’s comfortable. RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.author: emeacham

customer_reviews.title: Just look at it!
customer_reviews.text: I had doubts about this but my PF was so bad I was willing to try anything. This thing is incredibly hard to get on especially if it is going on your right foot. Plus my wife pretty much made me take it off as just turning over in bed was a chore. I ended up buying another more flexible, compact one that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Boatdog

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, surprisingly quick results!
customer_reviews.text: Plantar Faciitis is so frustrating - this splint is amazing and in just a few nights has improved my symptoms tremendously. It is a bit tough to sleep in,but not as difficult as I anticipated. It is very well made and sturdy for the price which I think is very reasonable. I would highly recommend this product to try - my mornings were very painful prior to using this product and now I am pretty much pain free after just a couple nights. I am continuing to wear the splint for complete healing (hopefully) but am amazed at how quickly my symptoms improved with this product.
customer_reviews.author: LEAS

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Size should depend on leg size instead of shoe size. Skinny legs need a small.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, this night splint is my third try. It works! The straps buckle on either side making it easy to use on either foot. It flexes the foot in the proper position for plantar fasciitis. My only complaint is the top strap is still too loose on my skinny legs but the 2 lower straps hold well enough to make it work. Haven't worn it enough yet to be able to say how much it helps but at least now I can find out. I wear a 81/2 shoe and needed a small because the sraps will not tighten enough on a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Libby R.

customer_reviews.title: It is super well designed and extremely light weight to our surprise
customer_reviews.text: Bought this device for my wife on the recommendation from her doctor. It is super well designed and extremely light weight to our surprise. The direction for fitting were simple and very easy to follow. She has been using it for about a week and there appears to be a marked improvement in the pain level on her foot. Hard to believe but it actually seems to work well. She would do it again for sure. By the way, the service from the company has been outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Figel

customer_reviews.title: This thing works when nothing else did!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why. I don't know how. But it works on my constant foot pain. I don't even need to wear it all night...and I have it set very loose. I do physical therapy, workout all the time and this silly boot keeps me going and is the only thing that helps my foot pain. If you are in the fence, TRY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not for me... sorry
customer_reviews.text: This boot, "contraption", actually made my foot pain worse. I would sleep with this overnight and my foot would be numb. I've woken in the middle of the night to remove it due to pain. Not heel pain but entire foot pain, numbness and throbbing. Plus, It's not comfortable to sleep in. I recently bought another model I used in the past--a bit pricer, made with cloth, and in just one night my heel pain is down by 95%! So yeah, this model is not for me. They're literally collecting dust in my closet. *Sigh*
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Y

customer_reviews.title: It helps
customer_reviews.text: This has really helped my planter fasciitis problem. My heal does not stay all the way down into the splint because my muscles are tight but, my muscles do stretch comfortably during the night with this on. I notice a difference in the morning and I feel less pain during the day. It is light weight and easy to put on. If I tighten the straps too much, my foot will fall asleep since my muscles don't want to stretch all the way. It can take a few days to find what works for you but when you do, it really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lybarger

product_meta.title: Mars Wellness Plantar Fasciitis Posterior Night Splint - Medium
feature_bullets: Truly universal-unique design includes buckles on both sides of the splint to allow easy on and off application for both the right and left foot.
Three padded straps with buckles to ensure immobilization
Dual tension straps allow for increased flexion and foot angle for the optimum pain releving stretch
Lightweight, low profile shell is sturdy and breathable. Open design keeps patients cool and dry
Essential treatment for alleviation of night time plantar fasciitis pain

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
